segments.text: I'm shocked at how much water is overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's pouring over the edge, creating a huge puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed it yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost like she's in her own little world, completely oblivious to her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of urgency, wishing I could warn her about the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle keeps growing, and I can't help but fear someone might slip and fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's frustrating to see such carelessness, especially with potential hazards around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout and tell her to turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I know she can't hear me, so I just watch and hope for the best.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't shake off this feeling of dread, anticipating an accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope everything turns out okay, but I'm not sure how much longer I can watch this.
segments.speaker: PAR
